subject: Psychology
title: The Limits of Behaviorism
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on The Limits of Behaviorism.

hook.text: A child says a sentence they've never heard before. Behaviorism can't explain how. Something more is happening.

buildup.text: Noam Chomsky's 1959 review of Skinner's work argued that language can't be explained by reinforcement alone.

discovery.text: Chomsky showed children generate novel sentences using innate grammar rules â€” not just learned responses.

twist.text: Behaviorism could explain habits and conditioning but not creativity, language, or complex problem-solving.

climax.text: Chomsky's critique opened the door for the cognitive revolution â€” the return of the mind to psychology.

punchline.text: Behaviorism explained the simple. Cognition explained the rest.

quiz.question: What did Chomsky's critique of Skinner argue?
options: Language cannot be explained by reinforcement alone
